text: this was a rally caught called by the
PDRC that's the movement that's running
the occupation of Bangkok they have had
rallies in other parts of the country
particularly in the south but down here
in the it once knows the eastern
seaboard there's also quite a lot of
support for the opposition it was a
rally to night market while it was going
on at nine o'clock at night some pickup
trucks drove past threw grenades and
opened fire with a variety of different
guns on the crowd there as a result more
than thirty were injured 29 of those are
still in hospital one five-year-old girl
died from a gunshot wound
and at least one other young child is in
very very critical condition she's been
transferred to another hospital that may
not survive to be honest this is
probably the most awful attack we've
seen so far and we've seen a number of
much smaller scale attacks on the
protesters here in Bangkok but they're
quite well guarded this provincial rally
was a lot more vulnerable and it comes
after a week of reverses for the
government where the anti-government
protesters have have got more strength
on their side particularly from a clash
which drove the police back on on
Tuesday where five people died and from
a Court decision that effectively barred
the police from using any force at all
against these protesters and I think
people will see this attack awful though
it is as a response to the government's
difficulties
